Khaleti，[Sk．kṣālayati of kṣal?] lit．to wash （cp．pakkhāleti），slang for “to treat badly，” “to give a rubbing” or thrashing （exact meaning problematic）； only at J．IV，205=382：gale gahetvā khalayātha jammaṁ “take the rascal by the throat and thrash him” （Com．khalayātha khalīkāraṁ （i．e．a “rub，” kind of punishment） pāpetvā niddhamatha=give him a thrashing & throw him out．v．l．at both passages is galayātha）．（Page 235）

khaleti：ခလေတိ （√ခလ်）
ဆေး၏။ ဆေးကြောသုတ်သင်၏။
